name: classic granny square
notes:
click [here][1] for an easy-to-follow guide to crocheting a traditional granny square. photos are included for each step!

materials

- a natural fiber yarn. for a warm coverlet, try [merino wool][2], [cashmere][3], or [alpaca][4].  for a light summer throw, try [cotton][5] and [silk][6] or [bamboo][7].
- a [crochet hook][8] in a size appropriate for your yarn. for bulky weight yarn, try a 8 – 10 mm hook. for worsted weight yarn, try a 4.5 – 5.5 mm hook. for sport weight yarn, try a 4 mm hook. for lace weight yarn, try a 2 – 5 mm hook.


  [1]: https://www.purlsoho.com/create/granny-squares/
  [2]: https://www.purlsoho.com/yarn/fiber_filter--merino_wool.html
  [3]: https://www.purlsoho.com/yarn/fiber_filter--cashmere.html
  [4]: https://www.purlsoho.com/yarn/fiber_filter--alpaca.html
  [5]: https://www.purlsoho.com/yarn/fiber_filter--cotton.html
  [6]: https://www.purlsoho.com/yarn/fiber_filter--silk.html
  [7]: https://www.purlsoho.com/yarn/fiber_filter--bamboo.html
  [8]: https://www.purlsoho.com/tools-and-notions/knitting-and-crochet.html?collection_filter=23805
